poem:
**Goldblum's Dance**

Hush in Corinthia's void,  
crystal and chrome collude.  
Then, a legend prowls,  
half-dancing, ages unmasked—  
Jeff's boom in the quiet.  
Quotes flutter as wisdom unfolds,  
refusing the sepia of years,  
acceptance in each creak and  
spring, life light on feet—  
a gold bloom in twilight's stage.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘It’s foolish to mask your age. Accept it. Present it’: Jeff Goldblum on vanity, mortality and becoming a father in his 60s It’s quiet in the courtyard bar of London’s Corinthia hotel, no other guests around, just me and a couple of waiters who tinkle glasses and wash cutlery. Suddenly, boom, a Jeff Goldblum goes off – rearranging furniture, sending quotes flying. The 71-year-old actor prowls in, light on his feet, half-dancing as if to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
